vectortransform

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • vectortransform.DecimalMatrix
      • vectortransform.Vector

  • public class Vector
extends DecimalMatrix
    Vector.java: Vector data structure with elements represented by Double values. Inherits from DecimalMatrix class. Can perform a number of different vector operations, as well as transform itself using transformation matrices.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Max Thurell

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class vectortransform.DecimalMatrix

        data, M, N

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector(java.lang.Double... values)
      Creates a vector from received values, with a length equal to the length of the value array.
      Vector(int M)
      Creates an empty Vector of indicated length.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
      Override of equals method.
      double get2DAngle(Vector v2)
      Gets the (signed) angle between two two-dimensional vectors, seen from a position orthogonal to the x-and-y-axes on a Cartesian plane.

      Gets the general angle between two vectors of arbitrary (but equal) dimensions.

      Gets the value of the first element in the vector, representing its x coordinate in a Cartesian coordinate system.

      Gets the value of the second element in the vector, representing its y coordinate in a Cartesian coordinate system.
      int hashCode()
      Creates a unique hashcode for this Vector.
      Vector reflect2DOrigin()
      Reflects this Vector around both axes, by changing the sign of both of its coordinates.
      Vector reflect2DX()
      Reflects this Vector around the x axis, by changing the sign of its y coordinate.
      Vector reflect2DY()
      Reflects this Vector around the y axis, by changing the sign of its x coordinate.
      Vector rotate2D(java.lang.Double angle, boolean isClockWise)
      Rotates this Vector around the origin point, by the given angle and in the given direction.
      Vector scaleProportional(double scalar)
      Scales the y and x values of this Vector up by the received scalar.

      Scales the x value of this Vector up by the received scalar.

      Scales the y value of this Vector up by the received scalar.

      Performs a shear mapping of a point along the x axis, based on its signed distance from the x axis (equivalent to its y coordinate).
      Vector shear2DY(double scalar)
      Performs a shear mapping of a point along the y axis, based on its signed distance from the y axis (equivalent to its x coordinate).
      void show()
      Prints the contents of this Vector to the console.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The hashcode for this Vector object.

      • get2DAngle

        public double get2DAngle(Vector v2)
        Gets the (signed) angle between two two-dimensional vectors, seen from a position orthogonal to the x-and-y-axes on a Cartesian plane.
        Parameters:
        v2 - Vector to find angle to.
        Returns:
        Angle between two vectors.

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle(Vector v2)
        Gets the general angle between two vectors of arbitrary (but equal) dimensions. Defined by the arccos value of the dot product of the matrices divided by the product of the magnitudes.
        Parameters:
        v2 - Vector to find angle to.
        Returns:
        Angle between two vectors.

      • scaleX

        public Vector scaleX(double scalar)
        Scales the x value of this Vector up by the received scalar.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar by which to scale the Vector.
        Returns:
        This Vector, scaled along the x axis by the given scalar.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This Vector, scaled along the y axis by the given scalar.

      • scaleProportional

        public Vector scaleProportional(double scalar)
        Scales the y and x values of this Vector up by the received scalar.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar by which to scale the Vector.
        Returns:
        This Vector, scaled along both axes by the given scalar.

      • reflect2DX

        public Vector reflect2DX()
        Reflects this Vector around the x axis, by changing the sign of its y coordinate.
        Returns:
        This Vector, reflected around the x axis.

      • reflect2DY

        public Vector reflect2DY()
        Reflects this Vector around the y axis, by changing the sign of its x coordinate.
        Returns:
        This Vector, reflected around the y axis.

      • reflect2DOrigin

        public Vector reflect2DOrigin()
        Reflects this Vector around both axes, by changing the sign of both of its coordinates.
        Returns:
        This Vector, reflected around the x axis.

      • rotate2D

        public Vector rotate2D(java.lang.Double angle,
                       boolean isClockWise)
        Rotates this Vector around the origin point, by the given angle and in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle by which to rotate, expressed in radians.
        isClockWise - Whether to rotate Vector clockwise or counter-clockwise.
        Returns:
        This Vector, rotated by a given angle in a given direction.

      • shear2DX

        public Vector shear2DX(double scalar)
        Performs a shear mapping of a point along the x axis, based on its signed distance from the x axis (equivalent to its y coordinate).
        Parameters:
        scalar - Replaces a zero-value element in the identity matrix and dictates the multiplicative size of displacement.
        Returns:
        This Vector, shear mapped along the x axis.

      • shear2DY

        public Vector shear2DY(double scalar)
        Performs a shear mapping of a point along the y axis, based on its signed distance from the y axis (equivalent to its x coordinate).
        Parameters:
        scalar - Replaces a zero-value element in the identity matrix and dictates the multiplicative size of displacement.
        Returns:
        This Vector, shear mapped along the x axis.

      • show

        public void show()
        Prints the contents of this Vector to the console. Vector must be two-dimensional.
        Overrides:
        show in class DecimalMatrix
